name: sti-qsm-demo
label: STI SUITE: Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping Pipeline (v2.2 DEMO)
description: Quantitative susceptibility mapping (QSM) and susceptibility tensor imaging (STI) are two recently developed imaging methods for quantifying tissue’s magnetic property. Magnetic susceptibility offers a new contrast for high-resolution anatomical imaging; it further provides important information on tissue’s chemical composition, especially myelin and iron, and white matter microstructures of the brain.
author: Chunlei Liu, Ph.D <STI.Suite.MRI@gmail.com>

Magnitude.description: Magnitude image (can be Matlab data (.mat) or NIfTI file). For Multi-echo magnitude/phase data 4D Data are in the order of X, Y, Z, echo 3D single echo data is also OK.

Phase.description: Phase image (can be Matlab data (.mat) or NIfTI file). For Multi-echo magnitude/phase data4D Data are in the order of X, Y, Z, echo 3D single echo data is also OK.

Brain_Mask.description: A binary brain mask (can be Matlab (.mat) or NIfTI data).

B0_vector.description: B0_vector. Please ensure this is correct! For axial scan, B0_vector=[0 0 1]. For oblique scan, B0_vector should be calculated from a dicom file associated with the multi-echo GRE scan. [DEFAULT==[0 0 1]==AXIAL]

TE.description: Echo Time (TE) of the first image in the unit of ms [DEFAULT=40]

DeltaTE.description: Difference between the TE of the first and susequent images.

iHARPERELLA.description: Integrated phase unwrapping and background phase removal. iHARPERELLA is an improved implementation of HARPERELLA. [DEFAULT=true]

V-SHARP.description: V-SHARP is modified version of the SHARP method by Schweser et al. It uses a varying spherical kernel to remove the background phase and preserve the contrast near the boundary of the brain. [DEFAULT=false]

V-SHARP_Radius.description: Size of spherical kernel radius for V-SHARP (DEFAULT=25)
